text:
Hey Glen, 
Merry Christmas to you & all. 
Appreciate your so many years hard work & dedication. 
Best wishes for your future assignments. 
Regards, 
Dhiraj

metadata.topic: Thanks, merry Christmas and so llong
metadata.subject: RE: [patchmanagement] Thanks, merry Christmas and so llong
metadata.email_text_original:

important [https://aka.ms/LearnAboutSenderIdentification] 
Hey Glen,

Best wishes for your future assignments. 
Regards, 
Dhiraj 
From: 'Glen Johnson' via PatchManagement <patchmanagement@googlegroups.com>
Sent: 20 December 2023 23:15
To: ntsysadmin@googlegroups.com; patchmanagement@googlegroups.com
Subject: [patchmanagement] Thanks, merry Christmas and so llong 
Greetings. Today is my last work day as network manager, IT coordinator and
general tech person at Virginia Highlands Community College where I have spent
the past 40 years.   I will officially retire on December 31 and am looking
forward to 
ZjQcmQRYFpfptBannerStart 
Caution : This email originated from outside of Sony. 
Do not click links or open any attachments unless you recognize the sender and
know the content is safe. Please report phishing if unsure. 
ZjQcmQRYFpfptBannerEnd 
Greetings. 
Today is my last work day as network manager, IT coordinator and general 
tech person at Virginia Highlands Community College where I have spent 
the past 40 years.  I will officially retire on December 31 and am 
looking forward to other adventures. 
I've been a member of the ntsysadmin list longer that I can think about 
(my oldest saved email, a joke, from that list is dated 2006) and the 
patch management list for several years also. 
I wanted to take a second to express a heart felt THANK YOU to all that 
participate in both of these most helpful lists.  You have been an 
invaluable part of making my career in IT a success. Thank you for 
sharing your knowledge, advice and most of all, your time.  I can't 
imagine being able to do half of what I did without this great resource. 
Merry Christmas to those of you that choose to celebrate this and best 
wishes to everyone. 
May patch Tuesdays be calm and all your systems run smoothly over the 
coming years. 
Take care and so long. 
Glen. 
--
Link: https://groups.google.com/d/msgid/patchmanagement/KL1PR0401MB462753E4125D8397A20A5C3E9094A%40KL1PR0401MB4627.apcprd04.prod.outlook.com
